title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 00:01  
flaviusolaru left at 00:16 (Quit: Leaving.  
Denis joined #xwiki at 00:17  
lucaa1 left at 00:48 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
abusenius left at 01:59 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 03:40  
venkatesh left at 03:42 (Client Quit  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 03:42  
Denis left at 06:01 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
baur joined #xwiki at 06:06  
Denis joined #xwiki at 06:09  
baur - (06:21): who has an experience with custom uathentication, mainly with registereing XWIKI users from an external web site  
baur - (06:21): I am using java wicket and Oracle 9i database  
cjdelisle - (06:26): You might want to consider commercial support over at xwiki.com, I think you can give them your requirements and get a developer to write the code you need.  
baur - (06:30): :)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 06:41  
cjdelisle - (07:20): what's the status of http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access Rights? I see a note about a draft but the draft project appears to be abandoned.  
vmassol - (07:21): status is somewhat started it but stopped so someone else need to clean up/finish  
cjdelisle - (07:22): "therefore don't change here anything" I don't like this, IMO if you have something better then replace the main page, don't restrain dev on the main page because you \_will\_ have something better.  
vmassol - (07:22): yes, it's fine if you do this very temporarily  
vmassol - (07:22): but not on a long period indeed  
vmassol - (07:23): what would be ideal  
vmassol - (07:23): is if you could take useful stuff from the draft, if there's any, merge it on the main page  
vmassol - (07:23): and remove the draft  
vmassol - (07:23): if it's too long just add whatever you want to the main page  
vmassol - (07:23): (and remove this warning)  
cjdelisle - (07:24): I'll do that now. I just had to bumble around a bit to figure out verified registration so I'll document, merge, cleanup.  
vmassol - (07:24): cool  
vmassol - (07:41): releasing core 2.6rc1  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:42  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 07:58  
vmassol - (08:20): core 2.6rc1 released  
vmassol - (08:20): releasing web 2.6rc1  
venkatesh left at 08:32 (Ping timeout: 250 seconds  
vmassol - (08:37): guys we have a big issue. On my local machine the 2.6 trunk build I'm running is very unstable  
vmassol - (08:37): after a few seconds of starting XE it hangs my machine  
vmassol - (08:37): (taking all resources)  
vmassol - (08:38): I'll download the latest build from hudson to see if it does the same  
vmassol - (08:38): (I'm running with an older build)  
cjdelisle - (08:40): jetty/hsql?  
vmassol - (08:40): yes  
cjdelisle - (08:41): A few days back tomcat took up all of my ram but I don't think it is the same since it went way over the -Xmx.  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 08:41  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 08:45  
baur left at 08:47 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:12  
rrodriguez left at 09:16 (Quit: rrodriguez  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:17  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 09:17  
vmassol - (09:36): sdumitriu: ping  
sdumitriu - (09:37): Pong  
vmassol - (09:37): what do you think about adding tools as dependencies in the pom so that they'll appear when we generate the release plan using the defined strategy  
sdumitriu - (09:37): I see that you've changed the versions in the release plan to 2.6 RC1  
vmassol - (09:38): yep  
sdumitriu - (09:38): Usually I put the version as it appears in the pom  
vmassol - (09:38): what version?  
sdumitriu - (09:38): 2.6-rc-1  
vmassol - (09:38): sure  
sdumitriu - (09:39): Hm, I don't get it, WDYM by that?  
sdumitriu - (09:39): What tools?  
vmassol - (09:39): "Also since several XWiki Tools are not used as Maven Dependencies but instead as configuration of Maven plugins (Maven Remote Resources Plugin for example) they won't appear in the list of dependencies computed with the above strategy. Thus it's important that you do a manual check of the tools versions to check whether they need to be released too. More specifically the xwiki-configuration-resources and xwiki-jetty-resources ones are i  
vmassol - (09:40): I'd like to remove this (which I've just added)  
vmassol - (09:40): basically mvn dependency:tree won't list them  
sdumitriu - (09:40): Oh, OK  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:40  
sdumitriu - (09:40): Let me think  
vmassol - (09:40): there's no perfect type though  
vmassol - (09:40): it would be either runtime or provided  
sdumitriu - (09:41): Jetty-resources is a dependency  
vmassol - (09:41): I don't see it  
sdumitriu - (09:42): In enterprise/dist/jetty/pom.xml  
vmassol - (09:42): it wasn't found in my plan  
sdumitriu - (09:42): It's marked as <optional>, maybe that's the reason  
vmassol - (09:42): indeed its there  
vmassol - (09:42): I need to check why it's not listed  
vmassol - (09:42): checking....  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:43  
vmassol - (09:44): it was found  
vmassol - (09:44): it's just that there were no changes  
vmassol - (09:44): so let's remove this one  
sdumitriu - (09:44): But configuration-resources seems to be just a resource bundle  
vmassol - (09:44): so the idea would be to do the same for config resources  
sdumitriu - (09:45): +1 for marking it as a dependency  
sdumitriu - (09:47): vmassol: "Fixed clirr exclusion which has been put in the wrong place " => Merge on trunk?  
vmassol - (09:47): right doing it  
vmassol - (09:47): I wanted to do it and it slipped my mind  
vmassol - (09:49): warning:I have two managmeent meetings today?..  
vmassol - (09:49): one starting in 10 minutes  
vmassol - (09:49): I'll be slow on finishing the release as a consequence  
sdumitriu - (09:50): I understand :)  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:55  
vmassol - (09:55): hmm  
vmassol - (09:56): sdumitriu: is it normal that svn merge changed lots of svn properties mergeinfo?  
vmassol - (09:56): you'll see in my commit  
cjdelisle - (09:56): Was Invitation rereleased with 2.5.1?  
vmassol - (09:56): I guess it's merge tracking feature of svn 1.6  
vmassol - (09:56): but still that sounds like a lot of changes  
vmassol - (09:57): (for a simple merge)  
sdumitriu - (09:58): cjdelisle: No  
sdumitriu - (09:58): You can look at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans#H2.5.1  
cjdelisle - (09:59): another release and XAINVITATION-15 still not fixed :(  
sdumitriu - (10:00): vmassol: I still think that SVN merge is lousy  
sdumitriu - (10:01): vmassol: After releasing core, don't you want to reset the parent to 37-SNAPSHOT?  
cjdelisle - (10:01): A semi-related question, does the release go through automated testing with the mix and match of versions?  
sdumitriu - (10:02): cjdelisle: XAINVITATION will be included in 2.6  
cjdelisle - (10:03): I see. How should I make sure in the future that an application will be released?  
sdumitriu - (10:04): I didn't include it in 2.5.1 since XAINVITATION-16 and XAINVITATION-14 are not safe for it  
sburjan - (10:04): cjdelisle: ping  
cjdelisle - (10:04): XAINVITATION-14  
cjdelisle - (10:05): pong  
sdumitriu - (10:05): Hm, why is it open?  
cjdelisle - (10:05): because I can't close an issue properly, apparently.  
sdumitriu - (10:05): vmassol: Are you releasing from the Hudson agent, or from another machine?  
sburjan - (10:06): I am trying to use the Invitation App on 2.5, but I think I have gotten in the bug you refereed above. Any idea how can I still use invitation application ?  
vmassol - (10:06): sdumitriu: hudson agent 1  
sdumitriu - (10:06): K  
vmassol - (10:06): sdumitriu: re parent, I left it to 37 voluntarily  
vmassol - (10:06): I prefer to leave the released values  
vmassol - (10:07): till we prove we need a newer one  
sdumitriu - (10:07): Hudson builds are waiting for the agent  
cjdelisle - (10:07): sburjan, go to bin/view/Invitation/ first.  
sburjan - (10:07): cjdelisle: i  have gone to /xwiki/bin/view/Invitation/ .I get some velocity code there, seems broken  
cjdelisle - (10:07): Not what I see.  
sdumitriu - (10:07): XAADMINISTRATION-183  
sburjan - (10:07): and goind on Invitation config from Admin panel, still spits an error  
sburjan - (10:08): cjdelisle: i get : This configuration cannot be displayed because it was last edited by XWikiGuest who doesn't have permission to edit this page.  
cjdelisle - (10:08): http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Invitation/  
sburjan - (10:09): yes.. I'm there  
sburjan - (10:09): let me give you a screenshot  
cjdelisle - (10:09): XWikiGuest doesn't (shouldn't) have permission to edit a page so something is wrong with the state of your wiki.  
sburjan - (10:10): great  
sburjan - (10:10): yes, on localhost works. I have a remote wiki that I have to configure  
sburjan - (10:10): could you take a look ?  
cjdelisle - (10:11): Oh, I see.  
cjdelisle - (10:11): Log in as admin, edit Invitation/InvitationConfig and save  
cjdelisle - (10:12): fixd  
sburjan - (10:13): thanks  
sburjan - (10:13): what was the problem ?  
cjdelisle - (10:13): Not quite sure hoe Invitation.WebHome was edited by guest but apparently it was.  
sburjan - (10:13): it's on a XEM ...  
sburjan - (10:13): odd  
sburjan - (10:13): macros on that wiki are also broken  
cjdelisle - (10:14): Yea, everything is saved as guest.  
cjdelisle - (10:17): I think I'll add a test to go to each admin section and make sure there is a save button.  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:21  
vmassol - (10:21): cjdelisle: if you do this don't make it part of the ui tests but instead part of the verifications tests (which verify best practices)  
vmassol - (10:21): (note: I haven't followed the discussion)  
cjdelisle - (10:21): It's looking for broken admin sections which aren't rendering properly.  
cjdelisle - (10:22): Trying to prevent future embarassments like XAINVITATION-15  
cjdelisle - (10:24): hmm no that makes no sense. Most sections don't have any save button.  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:28  
baur joined #xwiki at 10:28  
baur - (10:28): hi  
baur - (10:28): does XWIKI use hyperSQL database?  
evalica joined #xwiki at 10:29  
baur - (10:32): and is it does, what is the name of the database where the information about the users is stored?  
sburjan - (10:32): the information is stored in 1-2 text files  
sburjan - (10:34): in the database dir  
sburjan - (10:35): xwiki\_db.script file is responsable for creating the in-memory database  
baur - (10:35): oh in memory  
baur - (10:35): doesnt it use file typa storage  
baur - (10:35): ?  
sburjan - (10:35): so basically the jsql starts, and runs that file that contains sql queries .. and creates the db structure and fills it with data  
sburjan - (10:35): \*hsql  
baur - (10:36): I see  
baur - (10:36): thanks  
sburjan - (10:36): np  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:36  
baur - (10:41): can you please tell me in what files exactly the information is stored?  
vmassol - (10:42): baur:  you should'nt need that  
vmassol - (10:42): and you should never ever modify database files directly  
vmassol - (10:42): if you really need to modify database data directly use sql  
baur - (10:43): if I use hsql to connect to the xwiki database and then do some inserts , is it possible?  
vmassol - (10:43): (and again that's not recommended either - again at your own risks and perils)  
cjdelisle - (10:44): XWiki db is organised into a special type of schema ( http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DatabaseSchema )  
cjdelisle - (10:44): You will not find a list of user names in the database if you look.  
cjdelisle - (10:45): IMO trying to add users with sql is like trying to write to the harddrive with a magnetized needle.  
vmassol - (10:45): yep  
vmassol - (10:45): you should use xwiki apis  
Denis left at 10:46 (Quit: Leaving.  
baur - (10:48): if I use xwiki API in java code in my aaplication, will I be able to connect to XWIKI database and create a user from there?  
Stulle - (10:48): speaking of which, is there an easy way to rename a user? for example, would renaming the page of any given user do the trick?  
cjdelisle - (10:50): Stulle, you'd have to re-add them to all of the groups which they are a member of.  
cjdelisle - (10:51): `an easy way' no  
cjdelisle - (10:51): well... change first name + last name ;)  
cjdelisle - (10:53): baur, The easiest way I know to add users is create a script which posts to the register page and registers users for you.  
Stulle left at 10:53 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
baur - (10:54): where do I create that scirpt, in XWIKi or in external java application?  
baur - (10:55): I want to be able to register users from an external java application  
cjdelisle - (10:55): http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/Register?register\_first\_name=first&register\_last\_name&xwikiname=user&register\_password=password&register2\_password=password&[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
cjdelisle - (10:56): ^^ you can register using a link like that.  
cjdelisle - (10:56): Not really something I'd do in java. More a job for bash or perl but your call.  
sburjan - (11:31): cjdelisle: ping.  
jbrBridge - (11:32): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Where can I specify the location of xwiki.log (I have here 2 instances deployed in the same tomcat writing to the same file).  
cjdelisle - (11:32): pong  
cjdelisle - (11:33): dirk: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Logging  
sburjan - (11:35): cjdelisle: I have closed the wiki .. and I want to allow registrations only invitation based  
cjdelisle - (11:36): hmm not documented.  
cjdelisle - (11:37): So have you closed the wiki already?  
sburjan - (11:37): yes  
sburjan - (11:38): in order to see if I am allowed to register using invidation ID  
sburjan - (11:38): Invitations can not be accepted because this wiki is closed. To allow invitees to join, save InvitationGuestActions as a user with Programming Rights.  
mflorea left at 11:38 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan - (11:38): done that  
sburjan - (11:38): now checking  
sburjan - (11:38): getting : This invitation cannot be accepted because the wiki is not configured to allow new users.  
cjdelisle - (11:39): You saved InvitationGuestActions as Admin?  
sburjan - (11:39): yes  
cjdelisle - (11:39): That message should accompany the other one about "invitations can not be accepted..."  
lucaa left at 11:43 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:43  
cjdelisle - (11:45): I just got the registration form in an admittedly jury rigged setup.  
sburjan - (11:45): nop, I only get that error  
cjdelisle - (11:46): I'm guessing it has something to do with that "guest saves everything" issue.  
sburjan - (11:47): well I am saving InvitationGuestActions as Admin  
sburjan - (11:47): I saved all the pages that I was prompted to  
cjdelisle - (11:48): Hmm. I'd bet your admin has no PR.  
cjdelisle - (11:49): {{groovy}}println("has PR");{{/groovy}}  
sburjan - (11:50): on what page do you want this ?  
baur left at 11:51 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
baur joined #xwiki at 11:51  
sburjan - (11:52): org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: You don't have the right to execute this script  
sburjan - (11:52): yes.. you are right  
sburjan - (11:52): I pasted it on InvitationGuestActions  
sburjan - (11:52): so ... soething is wrong  
sburjan - (11:52): \*something  
cjdelisle - (11:52): There is no way to bypass the closed wiki without PR so unless you can get PR you won't be able to test that.  
sburjan - (11:53): and how do I do that ? :)  
cjdelisle - (11:53): No, if it's a farm wiki then not having pr is expected.  
sburjan - (11:53): why isn't that page saved with PR rights ?  
sburjan - (11:53): oh... ultra great :)  
cjdelisle - (11:54): `And how do I do that ?' I knew a couple ways but I fixed them ;)  
sburjan - (11:54): so my only optin is to ask for PR rights :)  
cjdelisle - (11:55): To test that function you will need PR.  
jvelociter - (12:01): cjdelisle: the invitation app require PR ?  
cjdelisle - (12:01): Only for inviting into a closed wiki.  
jvelociter - (12:01): what's the rationale ?  
cjdelisle - (12:02): There isn't any way to violate guest's ban on registering without PR.  
jvelociter - (12:02): ( I think we have a rule that says XE default XAR should not have a page requiring PR )  
florinciu1 joined #xwiki at 12:02  
sdumitriu - (12:02): cjdelisle: saveAsAuthor doesn't help?  
cjdelisle - (12:02): If there was then it'd be a security flaw.  
cjdelisle - (12:03): saveAsAuthor would allow it to work but that would be rewriting the user creation code.  
cjdelisle - (12:03): I could do that but I'd rather it be used everywhere and then drop use of xwiki.creatrUser entirely.  
florinciu1 left at 12:04 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
evalica left at 12:04 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
silviar left at 12:04 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu left at 12:04 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
silviar joined #xwiki at 12:05  
florinciu1 joined #xwiki at 12:05  
evalica joined #xwiki at 12:05  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 12:06  
Enygma` left at 12:08 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
sburjan left at 12:08 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
cjdelisle - (12:12): "( I think we have a rule that says XE default XAR should not have a page requiring PR )" I don't see that as being in violation because the default behavior doesn't require it, it's only needed for a specific use.  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 12:14  
Stulle - (12:16): hmm did my question regarding the rename of users make it to the channel? if so, what was the reply? apparently the web irc broke down for me...  
cjdelisle - (12:17): <cjdelisle> Stulle, you'd have to re-add them to all of the groups which they are a member of.  
cjdelisle - (12:17): <cjdelisle> `an easy way' no  
cjdelisle - (12:17): <cjdelisle> well... change first name + last name ;)  
Stulle - (12:18): i was thinking about changing the logon name, not just the first and last name  
cjdelisle - (12:18): That's not easy.  
Stulle - (12:19): thought so :)  
Stulle - (12:19): so just renaming the page won't do?  
Stulle - (12:19): or are the groups the problem?  
Stulle - (12:20): because i'm still only working with the two default groups, so that should prolly not be much of an issue  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 12:20  
cjdelisle - (12:21): I think groups are the only issue.  
Stulle - (12:22): i see. well, thanks for the input!  
Stulle - (12:29): i think i found a bug  
Stulle - (12:30): i am trying to create a page which should have the name "Öffnen in Pro/ENGINEER"  
Stulle - (12:30): note the Ö at the beginning  
Stulle - (12:30): i tried creating that page using a link i added in a nother page and the create page feature  
Stulle - (12:31): both fail, even though the create page feature says it should be fine  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:33  
Stulle - (12:34): ah, so the error was not the Ö but the / in the name  
vmassol - (12:43): sorry was in a meeting, continuing release  
vmassol - (12:44): starting config resources release  
baur left at 12:51 (Quit: Page closed  
Stulle - (13:00): created XWIKI-5651 for the error reported above  
sburjan - (13:00): cjdelisle, jvelociter : so .. what happens with my PR rights ? :)  
venkatesh left at 13:03 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:04  
cjdelisle - (13:09): I don't have any permission on that server...   bbiab coffee.  
vmassol - (13:13): hmm I don't understand why maven says: "There are still some remaining snapshot dependencies." in web-2.6 branch?.  
vmassol - (13:14): probably because of <platform.core.version>${project.version}</platform.core.version>  
vmassol - (13:14): makes sense  
vmassol - (13:14): so should I change to a fix number and reset it afterwards?  
vmassol - (13:14): (sdumitriu)  
vmassol - (13:14): (or jvdrean)  
vmassol - (13:15): I don't see another way to do it  
jvdrean - (13:16): vmassol: yes I think that's the reason  
vmassol - (13:17): yes it is, releasing now  
jvdrean - (13:17): we used to put the version directly and not ${project.version} in the past IIRC  
vmassol - (13:17): I'll revert it afterwards  
sdumitriu - (13:19): vmassol: Yes, ${project.version} is not allowed during releases  
Denis joined #xwiki at 13:34  
vmassol - (13:48): web 2.6rc1 tagged, and being uploaded to the maven repo  
vmassol - (13:48): next is activity stream plugin  
vmassol - (13:52): sdumitriu: I see activity stream was using shceduler plugin v1.20 but you've released 1.21 which means activity stream plugin wasn't using the right dep before  
vmassol - (13:53): I'm setting it to 1.21 now, I hope it'll be fine  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 13:55  
Enygma`1 left at 13:55 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (13:59): sdumitriu: are you doing the jira release for scheduler app/plugin?  
vmassol - (14:02): starting tag plugin release  
vmassol - (14:05): evalica: you've modified the tag application but without a jira issue  
vmassol - (14:05): you committed against the wrong jira issue  
vmassol - (14:06): "XE-736: Rename Main.RecentChanges to Main.RecentActivity to reflect the new implementation  
vmassol - (14:06): - Changed macro name from recentchanges to recentactivity"  
sdumitriu - (14:06): Denis: Ping  
evalica - (14:07): vmassol: platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/administration/src/main/resources/XWiki/XWikiUserProfileSheet.xml  
evalica - (14:07):    platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/tag/src/main/resources/Main/Tags.xml  
vmassol - (14:07): evalica: not sure why you're pasting this  
vmassol - (14:08): when you commit something for a project you need to have a jira issue for that project  
evalica - (14:08): yeap .... sorry - sergiu explained yesterday for the separator thing - that I need to make issues for every applciation I change  
vmassol - (14:08): ok  
vmassol - (14:08): I'll create this one for you this time :)  
evalica - (14:08): I pasted because apparently I changed tags and administration for the Profile  
sdumitriu - (14:08): vmassol: Sorry, I was doing a presentation; did you do the Jira release for scheduler?  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 14:08  
vmassol - (14:08): sdumitriu: nope  
vmassol - (14:08): (was waiting for your answer)  
sdumitriu - (14:09): K, I'll do it  
evalica - (14:09): vmassol: so you need to make one for administration too, right?  
vmassol - (14:09): evalica: yes, can you do that one?  
evalica - (14:09): k  
vmassol - (14:11): evalica: what is the jria issue that introduced the activity macro?  
vmassol - (14:11): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-736 should have a link to it  
vmassol - (14:11): or better there should be only one issue  
evalica - (14:12): XE-514  
vmassol - (14:12): no need to create so many issues  
vmassol - (14:12): actually XE-736 is invalid  
vmassol - (14:12): it says affects 2.5  
vmassol - (14:12): which is wrong  
vmassol - (14:12): since it wasn't there in 2.5  
vmassol - (14:12): so this issue shouldn't exist at all  
vmassol - (14:12): can you confirm that?  
evalica - (14:13): it wasn't in 2.5  
sdumitriu - (14:13): Are you sure?  
vmassol - (14:13): sdumitriu: I checked yesterday and anca confirmed it too  
vmassol - (14:14): (see my mail to anca on the list on that topic)  
vmassol - (14:14): ok so I'm closing XE-736 as invalid

xiuu - (15:11): could any1 pls explain how to add for example a field to the wysiwyg editor to change the color or the font size. i found this: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HXWikiPreferences  but dont really understand what i have to edit. im now here but theres no field which is called wysiwyg

sdumitriu - (15:14): Although it would be simpler to edit the configuration on the filesystem

xiuu - (15:14): field

sdumitriu - (15:15): mflorea: Help?  
mflorea - (15:16): xiuu: if you don't have access to the file system then editing the XWiki.XWikiPreferences is the only option  
mflorea - (15:17): as written on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HByeditingXWikipreferences  
mflorea - (15:18): first you have to make sure you have the wysiwyg.plugins and wysiwyg.toolbar properties defined. In order to check this you edit XWiki.XWikiPreferences with the class editor and see if they are present  
mflorea - (15:20): most probably you don't have them, so you just add them. both are string properties.  
mflorea - (15:21): xiuu: let me know if you managed to add these two properties to XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
xiuu - (15:26): got it :D  
xiuu - (15:26): mflorea:  
mflorea - (15:27): evalica: WYSIWYG events are listed here http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/WysiwygEditorModule#HCustomevents Maybe you should just add a link on DevGuide.JavaScriptAPI  
evalica - (15:27): super - thanks :)  
evalica - (15:28): the created was the one I found :)  
mflorea - (15:28): xiuu: you managed to put the color picker on the tool bar or just to add the prop to XWiki.XWikiPreferences?  
xiuu - (15:28): add the prop to the prefs  
mflorea - (15:28): great  
mflorea - (15:28): no you have to edit XWiki.XWikiPreferences with the object editor  
mflorea - (15:29): and set their value  
xiuu - (15:29): Objects of type XWiki.XWikiPreferences: DefaultSkin.  
xiuu - (15:29): this one?  
mflorea - (15:29): yep  
mflorea - (15:29): expand it  
mflorea - (15:30): and look at the end  
xiuu - (15:31): found the wysiwyg fields. now lets say i want to add a colorpicker and a fontpicker. 'color' and 'font'  
xiuu - (15:31): do i have to write it to both  
xiuu - (15:31): fields  
mflorea - (15:32): you have to fill both fields, but with different values. Try the values from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HConfigurationParameters  
mflorea - (15:33): i.e. look for the "plugins" and "toolbar" parameters and take their "default" value  
mflorea - (15:33): the third column  
mflorea - (15:34): as you can see, the plugins list includes "font" and "color", and the toolbar list includes "forecolor", "backcolor", "fontname" and "fontsize"  
xiuu - (15:34): yeah thats the thing i dont get, where do i have to write down the parameters  
xiuu - (15:34): ah ok, mom  
mflorea - (15:35): where you edit XWiki.XWikiPreferences in object mode  
xiuu - (15:35): but i have plugins and toolbars  
mflorea - (15:35): you have a field near "wysiwyg.plugins" and "wysiwyg.toolbar"  
xiuu - (15:35): which is a string  
mflorea - (15:35): yes  
xiuu - (15:35): yeah  
xiuu - (15:36): what do i write in plugins, what in toolbar  
xiuu - (15:36): colors|fontSizes  
xiuu - (15:36): like that?  
mflorea - (15:36): no  
mflorea - (15:37): just copy the default value of "plugins" configuration parameter from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HConfigurationParameters to the "wysiwyg.plugins" field in the object editor for XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
evalica left at 15:37 (Quit: Leaving.  
xiuu - (15:37): if i want colors, for example: #000000,#444444,#666666,#999999 ..............  
mflorea - (15:38): same with toolbar. copy the default value of "toolbar" configuration param to the "wysiwyg.toolbar" property of XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
xiuu - (15:38): how does he know that i mean selectable colors with that  
mflorea - (15:38): wait  
mflorea - (15:39): you have the color picker and font size on the toolbar already? :)  
xiuu - (15:39): NO  
xiuu - (15:39): wanna add them :)

mflorea - (15:39): that's a different thing

xiuu - (15:39): ok  
xiuu - (15:40): so how do i add the colorpicker. (with the default values)  
mflorea - (15:40): as I said above  
mflorea - (15:40): just copy the default value of "plugins" configuration parameter from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor#HConfigurationParameters to the "wysiwyg.plugins" field in the object editor for XWiki.XWikiPreferences  
mflorea - (15:40): and do the same with "toolbar" --> "wysiwyg.toolbar"

mflorea - (15:42): scroll down

xiuu - (15:45): the string in the object editor is called: wysiwyg.toolbar  
xiuu - (15:45): thats right?!  
mflorea - (15:45): yes, it correspond to the "toolbar" configuration parameter  
mflorea - (15:46): and "wysiwyg.plugins" corresponds to "plugins" configuration parameter

mflorea - (15:50): now, regarding customizing the colors, font names and font sizes  
mflorea - (15:53): unfortunately, currently there is no mapping between "colors", "fontNames", "fontSizes" configuration parameters and XWiki.XWikiPreferences properties (like we have between "toolbar" and "wysiwyg.toolbar"). As a consequence, customizing the colors, font names and font sizes is a but harder. There are two options: (1) modify templates/macros.vm in the file system (but you don't have access) or (2) attach a modified macros.vm to your skin (or XW

vmassol - (22:29): each one triggers a profile  
vmassol - (22:29): and these profiles define the same properties  
vmassol - (22:30): so they overwrite each other  
sdumitriu - (22:30): This isn't used when building  
vmassol - (22:30): so for ex when enterprise/distribution/jetty/hsqldb runs  
sdumitriu - (22:30): The outer -P defines which modules are activated  
vmassol - (22:30): it's derby settings that are used  
sdumitriu - (22:30): The one inside -Darguments defines the profiles used during the actual build
